front.title: A Privacy Mechanism for the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP)

abstract.t: This document defines new mechanisms for the Session InitiationProtocol (SIP) in support of privacy. Specifically, guidelines areprovided for the creation of messages that do not divulge personalidentity information. A new 'privacy service' logical role forintermediaries is defined to answer some privacy requirements thatuser agents cannot satisfy themselves. Finally, means are presentedby which a user can request particular functions from a privacyservice.
